page.title: 09WADDINGTON WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: The Waddington W.I. meets the second Wednesday of each month (except August) at 7.30 pm at the Village Hall. It is a place where women can meet, make friends and entertain. The members organise jumble sales and raise money for charity. They have recently brought two wheelchairs for the village. The members play tennis, golf, darts and go riding. At Christmas they go to the Grand Hotel. In the Church Hall they sing carols and have parties. Sometimes they have poetry days. The W.I. has talks to educate members and give advice on baby care. They cook and swap recipes. Waddington W.I.has 55 members and has won the shield for the best run institute in Lincolnshire for the past two years. The subscription is Â£4 and coffee is 10p. The minimum age is 14.
